      • getCurrentThreadAsJson

        public static java.lang.String getCurrentThreadAsJson()
        Gets the current thread that is running as represented by a JsonObject. It is converted to Json by getting the name of the thread and returning it as a JsonObject.
        Returns:
        The current thread.

      • getObjectInfoAsJson

        public static JsonElement getObjectInfoAsJson(java.lang.Object object)
        Gets the information of an object as a JsonObject. If object is null it return an instance of JsonNull. The information includes the following:
        • If object is null - returns JsonNull.
        • If object's class is assignable to Number - returns JsonPrimitive of the number.
        • If object's class is assignable to String - returns JsonPrimitive of the string.
        • If object's class is assignable to Character - returns JsonPrimitive of the character.
        • If object's class is assignable to Boolean - returns JsonPrimitive of the boolean.
        Otherwise, it returns a JsonObject with the following properties:
        • "class" - Class Name
        • LabeledObject
          • "label" - Label for the class
        • Array
          • "type" - Name of the component type
        Parameters:
        object - The object to return information about.
        Returns:
        The information about the object. If the argument is null, it returns an instance of JsonNull.

      • getThrowableAsJson

        public static void getThrowableAsJson(Message target,
                                      java.lang.Throwable throwable)
                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Gets the message and stack trace of a Throwable and adds it to the target message.
        Parameters:
        target - The target to add the message and stack trace onto.
        throwable - The throwable that the message and stack trace are being gotten from.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • checkArgument

        public static void checkArgument(java.lang.Object argument)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks an argument to see if it is null. Should only be used for checking constructor arguments for nodes.
        Parameters:
        argument - The argument to check if null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the argument is null.

      • checkArrayArguments

        public static void checkArrayArguments(java.lang.Object[] arguments)
                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Checks array to see if it is null, and then checks each of its individual values to see if it is null. Should only be used in constructor.
        Parameters:
        arguments - Array to check if it or any of its values are null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Throws if any value is null.
